alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 1:29AM MST until January 22 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM EARLY THIS MORNING TO 8 AM MST MONDAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Areas of snow above 6500 feet will spread west to east through the day today, slowly tapering off from west to east by tonight. Snow levels this morning may initially be above 7000 feet, but will fall as colder air moves across the region. Most locations will not see a steady, accumulating snowfall, more likely bursts of snow, that then melts between showers. * WHERE...Most locations above 6500 feet. * WHEN...From 5 AM early this morning to 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Periodic showers will cover up high country roads from time to time in the next 24 hours, use caution and watch for alerts when traveling. Snow forecast from 5 AM Today to 8 AM Monday: Alpine 1 to 3 inches Buffalo Pass 2 to 4 inches Doney Park 0 to 1 inches Flagstaff 1 to 2 inches Forest Lakes 2 to 4 inches Fredonia 0 inches Ganado 0 to 1 inches Grand Canyon 0 to 1 inches Heber-Overgaard 0 to 1 inches Jacob Lake 1 to 2 inches Kachina Village 1 to 3 inches Munds Park 1 to 3 inches North Rim 4 to 6 inches Pinetop-Lkside 1 to 3 inches Shonto 0 to 1 inches Show Low 0 to 1 inches Valle 0 to 1 inches Whiteriver 0 inches Williams 1 to 2 inches Window Rock 1 to 2 inches .
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
